001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of

004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.hal.FRCNetComm.tResourceType;
008import edu.wpi.first.hal.HAL;
009import edu.wpi.first.hal.util.AllocationException;
010import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.Sendable;
011import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.SendableBuilder;
012import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.SendableRegistry;
013
014/**
015 * Solenoid class for running high voltage Digital Output on a pneumatics module.
016 *
017 * <p>The Solenoid class is typically used for pneumatic solenoids, but could be used for any device
018 * within the current spec of the module.
019 */
020public class Solenoid implements Sendable, AutoCloseable {
021  private final int m_mask; // The channel mask
022  private final int m_channel;
023  private PneumaticsBase m_module;
024
025  /**
026   * Constructs a solenoid for a default module and specified type.
027   *
028   * @param moduleType The module type to use.
029   * @param channel The channel the solenoid is on.
030   */
031  public Solenoid(final PneumaticsModuleType moduleType, final int channel) {
032    this(PneumaticsBase.getDefaultForType(moduleType), moduleType, channel);
033  }
034
035  /**
036   * Constructs a solenoid for a specified module and type.
037   *
038   * @param module The module ID to use.
039   * @param moduleType The module type to use.
040   * @param channel The channel the solenoid is on.
041   */
042  public Solenoid(final int module, final PneumaticsModuleType moduleType, final int channel) {
043    m_module = PneumaticsBase.getForType(module, moduleType);
044    boolean allocatedSolenoids = false;
045    boolean successfulCompletion = false;
046
047    m_mask = 1 << channel;
048    m_channel = channel;
049
050    try {
051      if (!m_module.checkSolenoidChannel(channel)) {
052        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Channel " + channel + " out of range");
053      }
054
055      if (m_module.checkAndReserveSolenoids(m_mask) != 0) {
056        throw new AllocationException("Solenoid already allocated");
057      }
058
059      allocatedSolenoids = true;
060
061      HAL.report(tResourceType.kResourceType_Solenoid, channel + 1, m_module.getModuleNumber() + 1);
062      SendableRegistry.addLW(this, "Solenoid", m_module.getModuleNumber(), channel);
063      successfulCompletion = true;
064
065    } finally {
066      if (!successfulCompletion) {
067        if (allocatedSolenoids) {
068          m_module.unreserveSolenoids(m_mask);
069        }
070        m_module.close();
071      }
072    }
073  }
074
075  @Override
076  public void close() {
077    SendableRegistry.remove(this);
078    m_module.unreserveSolenoids(m_mask);
079    m_module.close();
080    m_module = null;
081  }
082
083  /**
084   * Set the value of a solenoid.
085   *
086   * @param on True will turn the solenoid output on. False will turn the solenoid output off.
087   */
088  public void set(boolean on) {
089    int value = on ? (0xFFFF & m_mask) : 0;
090    m_module.setSolenoids(m_mask, value);
091  }
092
093  /**
094   * Read the current value of the solenoid.
095   *
096   * @return True if the solenoid output is on or false if the solenoid output is off.
097   */
098  public boolean get() {
099    int currentAll = m_module.getSolenoids();
100    return (currentAll & m_mask) != 0;
101  }
102
103  /**
104   * Toggle the value of the solenoid.
105   *
106   * <p>If the solenoid is set to on, it'll be turned off. If the solenoid is set to off, it'll be
107   * turned on.
108   */
109  public void toggle() {
110    set(!get());
111  }
112
113  /**
114   * Get the channel this solenoid is connected to.
115   *
116   * @return The channel this solenoid is connected to.
117   */
118  public int getChannel() {
119    return m_channel;
120  }
121
122  /**
123   * Check if solenoid is DisabledListed. If a solenoid is shorted, it is added to the Disabled List
124   * and disabled until power cycle, or until faults are cleared.
125   *
126   * @return If solenoid is disabled due to short.
127   */
128  public boolean isDisabled() {
129    return (m_module.getSolenoidDisabledList() & m_mask) != 0;
130  }
131
132  /**
133   * Set the pulse duration in the PCM. This is used in conjunction with the startPulse method to
134   * allow the PCM to control the timing of a pulse. The timing can be controlled in 0.01 second
135   * increments.
136   *
137   * @param durationSeconds The duration of the pulse, from 0.01 to 2.55 seconds.
138   * @see #startPulse()
139   */
140  public void setPulseDuration(double durationSeconds) {
141    long durationMS = (long) (durationSeconds * 1000);
142    m_module.setOneShotDuration(m_channel, (int) durationMS);
143  }
144
145  /**
146   * Trigger the PCM to generate a pulse of the duration set in setPulseDuration.
147   *
148   * @see #setPulseDuration(double)
149   */
150  public void startPulse() {
151    m_module.fireOneShot(m_channel);
152  }
153
154  @Override
155  public void initSendable(SendableBuilder builder) {
156    builder.setSmartDashboardType("Solenoid");
157    builder.setActuator(true);
158    builder.setSafeState(() -> set(false));
159    builder.addBooleanProperty("Value", this::get, this::set);
160  }
161}
